name: Mercury
description: The smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun. It has a very thin atmosphere and experiences extreme temperature fluctuations.

name: Venus
description: Often referred to as Earth's 'sister planet' due to similar size, Venus has a thick, toxic atmosphere and surface temperatures hot enough to melt lead.

name: Earth
description: The only known planet to support life, Earth has a balanced atmosphere with oxygen, water, and suitable temperatures for life to thrive.

name: Mars
description: Known as the Red Planet due to its iron oxide-rich surface, Mars has the highest mountain and the deepest, longest valley in the Solar System.

name: Jupiter
description: The largest planet in the Solar System, Jupiter is a gas giant with a massive magnetic field and dozens of moons, including the largest, Ganymede.

name: Saturn
description: Famous for its stunning ring system, Saturn is another gas giant with many moons. It has a very low density, meaning it would float in water.

name: Uranus
description: An ice giant, Uranus is unique for rotating on its side, possibly due to a massive collision early in its history. It has faint rings and is composed mainly of water, ammonia, and methane.

name: Neptune
description: The farthest planet from the Sun, Neptune is another ice giant with intense winds, dark storms, and a strong blue color due to methane in its atmosphere.
